column4: Hello, anybody familiar with GtkFileSplitter? I'm splitting a 4GB file and it's been running for 3 hours. Is this normal? (512MB memory)
Single HDD?

I'm not familiar with Ubuntu at all, but it sound exaggerated either way. I suppose splitting from and to the same drive if you don't have DMA enabled for the HDD can take quite a while, but not 3 hours.
Does the HDD crunch a lot? Is there a progress indicator?
: OK I will research about DMA. I think this is true since my CPU load is kept under 50% the whole time (Not CPU load related). Thanks!
Maybe that software is just buggy for >4GB files.
If it's just splitting, anything will do I suppose.
For simple splitting, you could join it on Windows (or otherwise) even without any tools at all.
Just copy /b 1+2+3+4 out
Yes. Linux should have something similar.
Yeah. See how long 100MB takes. Is that file actually >4GB?
What, copy /b?
Oh, that was the simple part. The question is what's up with the speed. (Or >4GB problem.)
sudo hdparm /dev/hdc
To see if it's on.
Well, the general idea. :)
What's the exact filesize?
So my current idea would be that software having trouble with >4GB files.
Try RAR.
Never used it on Linux, but there's a binary for it, apparently. And you can set compression to "Store", then just use it as a splitter.
Yes.
Hmm... maybe p7zip then.
